intro: Rhynchospora crinigera var. spicata, commonly known as the spike rush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, cylindrical leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as bogs and swampy areas. Its flowers are small and clustered, with three stamens and a three-lobed pistil. Rhynchospora crinigera var. spicata plays an important ecological role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
